comments.html:
I don't think that Distributed Virtual Routers made it into the Icehouse release. You still need a dedicated network node.

Nothing mentioned in the release notes
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Icehouse#OpenStack_Network_Service_.28Neutron.29

It's something that is really needed to provide some performance parity with NSX for VMWare and Hyper-V networking.
comments.name: Adam Clark

comments.html: Distributed routing is there in Apache CloudStack 4.4 (https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/x/4Y5cAg). ARP packets are flooded into the mesh in a loop-free manner. The solution can be further optimized by implementing a local ARP proxy on each hypervisor node.

- layer-2 gateway glitches exist for all virtualization solution that do not use Openflow. It is more of architecture issue than do with Openflow. Why blame OF ?
- Proxy-ARP is more to do with vSwitch, why blame Openflow again ?

Agree, OF is re-inventing the forwarding plane wheel but it provides great features like table typing etc. Traditional forwarding plane has pretty fixed forwarding plane.
